message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MA, cs.CL, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a framework that combines actor-critic reinforcement learning with deep learning to solve the "learning-to-communicate" problem in multi-agent systems. This involves learning communication protocols in a partially observable environment. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems). Additionally, the paper discusses the learned protocols, which suggests a focus on natural language processing and communication, making cs.CL (Computation and Language) a likely sub-category. Finally, the use of deep learning technology also suggests cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as a possible sub-category.
